meta.name: description
meta.content: Danbury Independent School District is located in Danbury, TX.

aside.span: Dedication to Excellence and Achievement For All

li.a: DES CATT Community and Teachers Together

img.alt: Photo by Jeffrey Hamilton on Unsplash
Photo by moren hsu on Unsplash

div.aside: Updates from emailed announcements shared here

p.strong: Email Lisa Menard if you would like News & Announcement Updates emailed to YOU!
Contact her @ Lisa.Menard@danburyisd.org or call the Administration Office @ 979-922-1218.

div.p: The Danbury administration has been working diligently to create a grading system that is equitable and fair in this time of unprecedented personal and educational upheaval. A plan was sent to teachers to review, and parents can access it now also (see attached). While there are guidelines within which we must operate, we are very cognizant that these are difficult times and it is our intent to fairly assess students attempting to complete assignments. Thank you for your patience as we continue to try to do what is best for all our students.
Please see guidelines links below
DISD Administration Office will be closed until further notice beginning Friday, April 3rd. Staff will be working remotely.

If you have requested to check out a device for Distance Learning, the scheduled drive-thru event is still scheduled for Monday, April 6th to pick up the device. Pick up times are 9:00 a.m. – 11:00 a.m. and 5:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m. at the Administration Office.
You may receive a call or an email to make arrangements for pickup of the device prior to the drive-thru event.
For more information regarding checkout of a device, go to the website at www.danburyisd.org, click on the COVID-19 information box, look for the link Need a Device?
If you have questions, please contact Stacey Matheson, Technology Director, at Stacey.Matheson@danburyisd.org.
To contact any DISD staff member by e-mail, go to the DISD website at www.danburyisd.org
For Administration Staff: Under the ABOUT US tab, click on DISTRICT STAFF
For Campus Staff: Under the SCHOOLS tab, click on STAFF
Facebook: Danbury ISD - Send a MESSAGE
By Phone: Call (979) 922-1218

Automated system will answer – Press 0 (zero) for the Operator. After a period of silence, a message will give the option to leave a message. Press 1 to leave a message with Lisa Menard, Secretary to the Superintendent. Messages will be checked daily.
Effective immeicately, there should be no more than 10 people in Humber Stadium at a time. Those that are in the stadium, and on the track or field should practice social distancing.

The Houston Food Bank will once again provide a Mobile Food Pantry to families of Danbury ISD and Danbury ISD Senior Citizens. ID will be required to show proof of residency within Danbury ISD. This is a drive-through event.
When: Monday, April 6, 2020
Distribution Time: 9:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m.
Location: Band Hall behind Danbury Elementary School

Directions: From 5th Street turn on to Avenue F. Turn right on to Third Street. Left on to gravel road (Avenue G). ID will be checked at this point. MUST BE RESIDENT OF DANBURY ISD. Items will be distributed at Band Hall location. Exit at 1st Street. These directions must be followed as written.
If you have questions, please contact Disa Schulze, Director of Support Services, at Disa.Schulze@danburyisd.org.

p.u: Public Health Message from Texas Education Agency

div.p: The Danbury ISD community must work together to fight COVID-19. Head to http://tea.texas.gov/staywell for vitally important public health guidance to stop the spread. If we stand apart as a community now, we will be together again soon.
See images below from TEA.

Danbury ISD has moved to remote instruction for students and teachers should now be assisting students/parents as needed to support distance learning. Teachers have been sharing opportunities for students to practice and reinforce academic content and skills using familiar tools currently used in the classroom. We encourage everyone to review our Danbury ISD COVID-19 Response webpage @ www.danburyisd/covid-19/

The Distance Learning Plan is posted on the Covid-19 webpage and also links for students/parents regarding Technology. There are 4 interactive documents that we are asking students/parents to fill out if they haven’t already supplied this information to staff members.

There is a Technology Survey for Distance Learning – We want to ensure that students have the equipment they need for learning. If a device such as a Chromebook or a calculator is needed, then we will try to provide those items as requested and as available but we will need to know that information as requested on the Need a Device survey. Once this survey is filled out then we will reach out to parents with a specific time for device pick up if they are not able to pick up a device during the designated Device Pick up Day on April 6th. Also, The Need Technology Support link allows students/parents to email the school district’s technology department if additional technology help is needed while working on school work. Finally, the Need a Password Reset is the survey that will be used if students need their password reset for programs they are using during this remote instruction time.
Additional Resources may also be found on the page and we encourage you to review the topics of Internet Access, Apps for Video Calling, Resources and Links to our Staff emails.

There will be a Device Pick Up Day on Monday, April 6th from 9:00 am – 11:00 am and also from 5:30 pm – 6:30 pm in the circle drive next to Danbury Middle School/Danbury Administration office. This is a curbside pickup for either a Chromebook or Calculator as requested and as available and approved. A parent must complete the Need a Device survey for approval and before the pickup occurs.

If you have any questions about the Surveys or the Device Pick Up Day then please email Danbury ISD Technology Director Stacey Matheson @ Stacey.Matheson@danburyisd.org. If you have not been able to speak with a teacher or do not have online capabilities, please contact campus personnel by e-mail.
Amy Vrazel – Danbury High School @ Amy.Vrazel@danburyisd.org
Annie Sralla – Danbury Middle School @ Annie.Sralla@danburyisd.org
Jennie Edmonson – Danbury Elementary School @ Jennie.Edmonson@danburyisd.org

We have very limited staff working in the district during this time. If you need to contact a staff member, please attempt to contact them by e-mail. Email information can be located by logging into the DISD website at www.danburyisd.org, Click on the SCHOOLS tab, then under the campus name, click on the link for STAFF and then the link for the staff member’s e-mail.

If you are having difficulties contacting a staff member by e-mail or have not received a response, please feel free to call the Administration Office at (979) 922-1218 between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 2:00 p.m., Monday – Friday. We are happy to help in any way that we can.
From Superintendent Nancy Sandlin

There have been 42,922 people tested and 3,266 confirmed positive in Texas. At least 122 counties have at least one person who has tested positive. Sadly, 41 Texans have died due to the disease. Because we are at a critical time in the fight of this disease, social distancing is to be continued.

The Governor just extended school building closure until May 4th. We will continue remote instruction and will give you more information as it is available. Stay in touch with your teachers and principals, as we are working hard to create plans and guidance for our continued distance learning.
Continue to monitor e-mails and the DISD website for updates.

The Houston Food Bank will once again provide a Mobile Food Pantry to families of Danbury ISD and Danbury ISD Senior Citizens. ID will be required to show proof of residency within Danbury ISD. This is a drive-through event.
When: Monday, April 6, 2020
Distribution Time: 9:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m.
Location: Band Hall behind Danbury Elementary School

Directions: From 5th Street turn on to Avenue F. Turn right on to Third Street. Left on to gravel road (Avenue G). ID will be checked at this point. MUST BE RESIDENT OF DANBURY ISD. Items will be distributed at Band Hall location. Exit at 1st Street. These directions must be followed as written.
If you have questions, please contact Disa Schulze, Director of Support Services, at Disa.Schulze@danburyisd.org.
Please see the attached letter regarding an Update on Food Assistance, SNAP, Unemployment Benefits, and Federal Stimulus Package.
For more information go to their website at www.hungerfreetexans.org.
Please continue to check the website for updated scholarship information. On the homepage click on STUDENTS and then click on SCHOLARSHIPS.

We have very limited staff working in the district during this time. If you need to contact a staff member, please attempt to contact them by e-mail. Email information can be located by logging into the DISD website at www.danburyisd.org, Click on the SCHOOLS tab, then under the campus name, click on the link for STAFF and then the link for the staff member’s e-mail.

If you are having difficulties contacting a staff member by e-mail or have not received a response, please feel free to call the Administration Office at (979) 922-1218 between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 2:00 p.m., Monday – Friday. We are happy to help in any way that we can.

p.u: Message from DISD Superintendent – Nancy Sandlin

div.p: Dear Parents,

Congratulations! You and your children have now completed one whole week of remote instruction! We are getting great feedback from you and your teachers. Thank you for your patience in allowing us to set-up and learn systems so we can create a learning platform we can all use.

That being said, I need to remind you that your students must complete the lessons (paper or digital) as assigned. These lessons, in addition to the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd nine weeks’ grades, will be utilized in determining placement or advancement to the next grade level for the 2020-2021 school year. As problems arise, please contact your child’s teacher(s) and allow them to help you work through the issues. We are all in this together and we are amazed at what we’ve accomplished together, as a team, in just two weeks’ time. This has been a true example of what parents, students, and schools can do when we all work together. What a wonderful community we have!

p.u: Danbury ISD Distance Learning Plan (DLP) – March 2020 through TBA

div.p: Please click on the following link to go the Danbury ISD Distance Learning Plan. Remote learning began on Monday, March 23rd.

u.span: Meal Service Plan – Updated Bus Routes and Curbside Pickup Information

p.span: Danbury ISD Child Nutrition Department is federally funded and regulated. For information about this funding through USDA and TDA go to
Because DISD does not meet the criteria required to provide meals to our students with federal funds, we are working together with Angleton ISD.

Angleton ISD Child Nutrition Department will offer a free meal to ALL children 18 or younger, including Danbury ISD children. Child(ren) must be present when meals are picked up. They have added another route to their schedule. Please see attached schedule for the adjusted bus routes and information regarding curbside service.
If you have questions, please contact Disa Schulze at Disa.Schulze@danburyisd.org or Lisa Menard at Lisa.Menard@danburyisd.org.

div.p: The Houston Food Bank is still set up and still has food available. If you have an elderly neighbor, relative, or know of someone in the Danbury ISD that may not receive these messages, please contact them and let them know that distributions will continue until 11:00 a.m. or until the food runs out.

The Houston Food Bank is providing a Mobile Food Pantry to families of Danbury ISD and Danbury ISD Senior Citizens. ID will be required to show proof of residency within Danbury ISD. This is a drive-through event.
When: TODAY!! Monday, March 23, 2020
Distribution Time: 9:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m.
Location: Band Hall behind Danbury Elementary School

Directions: From 5th Street turn on to Avenue F. Turn right on to Third Street. Left on to gravel road (Avenue G). ID will be checked at this point. MUST BE RESIDENT OF DANBURY ISD. Items will be distributed at Band Hall location. Exit at 1st Street. These directions must be followed as written.
If you have questions, please call the Administration Office at (979) 922-1218.

Please continue to monitor e-mails and the website for continuous updates. If you know of someone that does not receive these messages but would like to, have them contact Lisa Menard at (979) 922-1218.

The Houston Food Bank will provide a Mobile Food Pantry to families of Danbury ISD and Danbury ISD Senior Citizens. ID will be required to show proof of residency within Danbury ISD. This is a drive-thru event.
When: Monday, March 23, 2020
Distribution Time: 9:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m.
Location: Band Hall behind Danbury Elementary School

Directions: From 5th Street turn on to Avenue F. Turn right on to Third Street. Left on to gravel road (Avenue G). ID will be checked at this point. MUST BE RESIDENT OF DANBURY ISD. Items will be distributed at Band Hall location. Exit gates at 1st Street. These directions must be followed as written.
If you have questions, please contact Disa Schulze, Director of Support Services, at Disa.Schulze@danburyisd.org.

p.u: Danbury ISD Distance Learning Plan (DLP) – March 2020 through TBA

div.p: Please see attached.

Middle School & High School parents - Our teachers are in the process of trying to contact parents of their Panther Time students to confirm internet capabilities and how best we can serve you and our students in these unusual circumstances. The calls may come through as a private number, so we are asking that you please answer if you are able. If you have any questions, please contact Amy Vrazel @ amy.vrazel@danburyisd.org or Annie Sralla @ annie.sralla@danburyisd.org.
Please continue to monitor e-mails and the website for continuous updates.

Danbury Little League will be offering free hotdog and french fry baskets to any families that may be in need of a meal tonight. Pick up at the Danbury Ball Fields tonight from 5:00 – 6:00 p.m. until supplies run out.
Danbury ISD Child Nutrition Department is federally funded and regulated. www.squaremeals.org

Because DISD does not meet the criteria required to provide meals to our students with federal funds, we are working together with Angleton ISD and the Houston Food Bank to provide meals to our students and community members.

Angleton ISD Child Nutrition Department will offer a free meal to all children 18 or younger, including Danbury ISD children. Child(ren) must be present when meals are picked up. The schedule and locations are as follows:

ul.li: This district is doing one curbside pickup location at Angleton Junior High School (location on the Henderson side of campus). Hours are 10:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. weekdays.
Meals will run from three buses making multiple stops on weekdays. The complete bus schedule is listed below:

The Houston Food Bank will provide a Mobile Food Pantry to the Danbury Community.
When: Monday, March 23, 2020
Time: 8:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m.

If you have questions, please contact Disa Schulze, Director of Support Services, at Disa.Schulze@danburyisd.org.

p.strong: DANBURY ISD to suspend normal operations through April 10

div.p: Danbury ISD Superintendent Nancy Sandlin has announced that Danbury ISD will extend the suspension of normal district operations through Friday, April 10th in an effort to support the nation’s need to flatten the curve of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Houston area continues to see an increasing number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 and health officials report that this number is expected to continue to increase as more testing is made available.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has outlined the need for all communities to implement a social distancing protocol. The President has publicly shared that the community should not gather in groups larger than 10 people. The District will remain flexible as leaders plan for long-term delivery of instruction and continue to navigate the many details of this unprecedented situation.

Please continue to monitor your email and visit the District website and social media channels for more information on plans to deliver instruction and information on our feeding program. The health of Danbury ISD students, staff and community is the District’s top priority and District leaders are working to ensure the community has the most current information available.

District Administration office hours, while schools are closed, are from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. You may call (979) 922-1218 if you have questions, and we ask that you please call or e-mail to make an appointment before coming to the Administration Building.

Campuses are closed but you can e-mail campus administrators, teachers, and staff members with questions. Go to the website at www.danburyisd.org and under the Schools tab, you will find contact information for all campus personnel.
Continue to monitor emails and the website for announcements.

Danbury ISD Administrators are meeting daily and will meet with teachers tomorrow to plan for the continued education of our students. Teachers will be meeting to set up high tech and low tech instruction.
STAAR Testing for the 2019-2020 school year has been waived by the state. We are waiting on the Federal government to waive the federal requirements.
Our food service department Is working on a plan to provide food and/or meals to the community.
All Danbury ISD extra-curricular activities are postponed until further notice. Any scheduled use of facilities for meetings, etc., will need to be rescheduled as campus buildings are closed.
Continue to monitor e-mails and announcements regularly. We will be updating the website continuously as information becomes available.
Thank you for your patience and support.
With the closing of schools next week, Danbury ISD Administrators and staff are working to implement plans to comply with requirements set forth by state and federal agencies.
Area Superintendents are meeting daily as well throughout our county, region, and state.
Effective immediately, all Danbury ISD extra-curricular activities are postponed until further notice.
We encourage parents, staff, and community members to monitor e-mails and announcements regularly. We will be updating the website continuously as information becomes available.
Thank you for your patience and support.

Due to the rapidly evolving nature of the coronavirus (COVID-19) and out of an abundance of caution, Danbury ISD is joining other Houston and Brazoria County area districts to close schools the week of March 16 – 20 to help prevent exposure to students, staff and the community.
The district will re-evaluate any further need for closure no later than March 20.

Information regarding scheduled activities including athletics events will be provided by the end of the day tomorrow, Friday, March 13th and the website Calendar of Events will be updated accordingly. At this time, DHS Softball scheduled for tomorrow vs. Hitchcock has been postponed until further notice.
We ask that parents monitor your e-mail accounts for updates from Danbury ISD.
